commands.shortDescription: Set or query the device name of application
commands.description: This command sets or queries the device name of the application.

queryResponse.description: Returns the selected device name

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the device name of the application
Returns the selected device name of the application

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the suite name of the application
commands.description: This command sets or queries the suite name of the application.

queryResponse.description: Returns the selected suite name

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the suite name of the application
Returns the selected suite of the application

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the test name of the application
commands.description: This command selects or deselects the specified test name of the application.

arguments.name: testname
arguments.description: Test name to select or deselect

uiHint.description: Use tree view or card selection for large enumeration

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value: Included or Excluded (1 for Included, 0 for Excluded)

validValues.notes: 1 or Included = enabled, 0 or Excluded = disabled

queryResponse.description: Returns True/1 for Included, False/0 for Excluded

codeExamples.resultDescription: Selects the specified test in the Test Panel
Returns the list of selected tests

notes: This command has a large enumeration (100+ test names). Consider using a tree view or card selection UI instead of a dropdown.

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the general parameter values
commands.description: This command sets or queries the general parameter values of the application. The value depends on the selected parameter name.

values: Email when test setup change in needed
Auto increment report name if duplicate
Auto close Warnings and informations during Sequencing Auto close after <no> Seconds
Auto close Error Messages during Sequencing. Show in Reports. Auto close after <no> Seconds
Show messages with a beep sound.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Parameter value (depends on ParameterName selected above)

Signal Validation: Use signal as is - Dont Check
Skip test if signal validation fails
Measurements: Displays the selected measurements to configure

validValues.notes: Value is conditional based on ParameterName. For PresetGen2 and PresetGen3, multiple presets can be combined with underscores (e.g., P1_P11_P7). When adding a preset, all existing presets along with the new one must be specified. Report Generation Template Path and Report Path accept file paths as strings.

queryResponse.description: Returns the parameter value as number or string

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the value for the specified general parameter
Returns the value for the specified general parameter

scpi.description: Selects presets 1, 7, and 11 from preset cal Gen2

codeExamples.resultDescription: Selects presets 1, 7, and 11 from preset cal Gen2

notes: The value depends on the ParameterName selected. Use the parameterMapping to see valid values for each parameter.
For PresetGen2 and PresetGen3, multiple presets can be combined with underscores (e.g., P1_P11_P7).
When adding a preset, all existing presets along with the new one must be specified.
Gen2 Ctle Index and Gen3 Ctle Option are applicable only when Test Method is selected DPOJET in DUT panel.
Report Generation Template Path and Report Path accept file path strings.
This command may benefit from a dynamic UI that updates available values based on the selected ParameterName.

commands.shortDescription: Query the available devices in the DUT panel of the application
commands.description: This command queries the list of available devices on the DUT panel as comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of available devices as comma separated values

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of available devices

commands.shortDescription: Query the available suites for the selected device
commands.description: This command queries the list of available suites for the selected device as comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of available suites as comma separated values

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of available suites for the selected device

commands.shortDescription: Query the list of available tests of the application
commands.description: This command queries the list of available tests of the application for the selected device as comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of available tests as comma separated values

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of available tests for the selected device

commands.shortDescription: Query the available version names of the application
commands.description: This command queries the list of available version names of the application for the selected device as comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of version names as comma separated values

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of version names for the selected device

commands.shortDescription: Query the list of available instruments based on the specified instrument type
commands.description: This command queries the list of available instruments based on the specified instrument type.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of available instruments

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of available instruments based on the real time scope type

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the IP address of the instrument based on the specified instrument type
commands.description: This command sets or queries the IP address of the instrument based on the specified instrument type.

queryResponse.description: Returns the IP address of the oscilloscope

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the oscilloscope to the specified IP address
Returns the IP address of the oscilloscope

commands.shortDescription: Query the information of the generated report file
commands.description: This command queries the information of the generated report file in the format "<FileSize>","<FileName>". A session should be run earlier and the report should be generated to get the information of the report.

queryResponse.description: Returns the information of the generated report

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the information of the generated report in the format ("1215","DUT001.mht")

notes: A session should be run earlier and the report should be generated to get the information of the report.

commands.shortDescription: Query the information of the generated waveform files
commands.description: This command queries the information of the generated waveform files. If there are more than one waveform, the waveform file names are displayed with the comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the information of the generated waveform files

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the information of the generated waveform in the format (20000858,"X:\USB4\Untitled Session\DUT001\20200916_041609\Iter1_Short Record-length for SCOPE Period_NoSSC_DIFF.wfm")

commands.shortDescription: Query the information of the generated image files
commands.description: This command queries the information of the generated image files. If there are more than one image, the image file names are displayed with the comma separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the information of the generated image files

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the information of the generated image in the format (109058, "X:\USB4\Untitled Session\DUT001\20200916_041609\Iter1_Short Record-length for SCOPE Period_NoSSC_DIFF.png";22794,"X:\USB4\UntitledSession\DUT001\20200916_041609\ScopePeriodPlot_Iteration1WithCursor.png")

commands.shortDescription: Query the active TekExpress application name
commands.description: This command queries the active TekExpress application name running on the oscilloscope.

queryResponse.description: Returns the active TekExpress application name

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the active TekExpress application name running on the oscilloscope

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the DUTID of application
commands.description: This command sets or queries the DUTID of the application.

queryResponse.description: Returns the DUTID of the application

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the DUTID of the application to DUT001
Returns the DUTID of the application

commands.shortDescription: Sets or query the acquire mode status
commands.description: This command sets or queries the acquire mode status.

queryResponse.description: Returns the current acquire mode

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the acquire mode to the Live mode
Returns the current acquire mode

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the execution mode status
commands.description: This command sets or queries the execution mode status.

queryResponse.description: Returns the current execution mode

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the execution mode to the compliance mode
Returns the current execution mode

commands.shortDescription: Generate the report for the current session
commands.description: This command generates the report for the current session.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Generates the report for the current session

commands.shortDescription: Query the value of specified report header field in the report
commands.description: This command queries the value of specified report header field in the report. Device field is the header name of each field in the setup information section of the report.

arguments.name: devicefield
arguments.description: Device field is the header name of each field in the setup information section of the report (e.g., "DUT ID")

queryResponse.description: Returns the value of the specified report header field

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the value of DUT ID field in the report

commands.shortDescription: Query the value of specified result detail available in report summary/details table
commands.description: This command queries the value of specified result detail available in report summary/details table. Can be used with 1-3 arguments: TestName only, TestName and ColumnName, or TestName, ColumnName, and RowNumber.

arguments.name: testname
arguments.description: Test name of which the details are required in the report

arguments.name: columnname
arguments.description: Column header name of which the details are required in the report

arguments.name: rownumber
arguments.description: Row number of which the details are required in the report

queryResponse.description: Returns pass/fail status (TestName only), all row values of specific column (with ColumnName), or column value of specified row (with RowNumber)

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the pass fail status of test

codeExamples.description: Query all row values of specific column
codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns all the row values of specific column for the test with comma separated values

codeExamples.description: Query column value of specified row
codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the column value of specified row number

commands.shortDescription: Restore the setup to default settings
commands.description: This command restores the setup to default settings.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Restores the setup to default settings

commands.shortDescription: Save the setup
commands.description: This command saves the setup.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Saves the setup

commands.shortDescription: Save the settings to a specified session
commands.description: This command saves the settings to a specified session.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Saves the settings to a specified session

commands.shortDescription: Open the setup from a specified session
commands.description: This command opens the setup from a specified session.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Opens the setup from a specified session

commands.shortDescription: Query the current setup file name
commands.description: This command queries the current setup file name.

queryResponse.description: Returns the current setup file name

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the current setup file name

commands.shortDescription: Run/stop/pause/resume the selected measurements execution in the application
commands.description: This command run/stop/pause/resume the selected measurements execution in the application.

queryResponse.description: Returns the operation mode

codeExamples.resultDescription: Runs the execution for the selected measurements

commands.shortDescription: Query the current measurement execution status
commands.description: This command queries the current measurement execution status.

queryResponse.description: Returns the current measurement execution status

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the current measurement execution status

commands.shortDescription: Query whether the current setup is saved or not saved
commands.description: This command queries whether the current setup is saved or not saved.

queryResponse.description: Returns whether the current setup is saved or not saved

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns whether the current setup is saved or not saved

commands.shortDescription: Exit or close the application
commands.description: The command exits or close the application.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Closes the application

commands.shortDescription: Query the status of the previous command execution
commands.description: This command queries whether the previous command execution is completed successfully.

queryResponse.description: 1 or True indicates that command execution is successful. 0 or False indicates that command execution is failed.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns whether the previous command operation is completed successfully

commands.shortDescription: Query the last error occurred
commands.description: This command queries the last error occurred.

queryResponse.description: Returns the last error occurred

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the last error occurred

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the popup details
commands.description: This command sets or queries the popup details.

queryResponse.description: Returns the pop-up details in format: Title, message, and available responses
queryResponse.example: "Do you really want to exit TekExpress?","Responses: Yes, No"

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the popup response to Yes
Returns the popup details in following format: "Do you really want to exit TekExpress?";Responses: "Yes, No"

commands.shortDescription: Sets or query the limit values in the limits editor window
commands.description: This command sets or queries the limit values in the limits editor window.

queryResponse.description: Returns the limits value for the specified testname and limit header

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the limits value for the specified testname and limit header
Returns the limits value for the specified testname and limit header

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the waveform file recalled for the specified test name and acquire type
commands.description: This command set or queries the waveform file recalled for the specified test name and acquire type. If there are more than one waveform, the waveform file names are displayed with the symbol "$" separated values.

queryResponse.description: Returns the waveform file name recalled for the specified testname and acquire type

codeExamples.resultDescription: Recalls the specified waveform file for the specified testname and acquire type
Returns the waveform file name recalled for the specified testname and acquire type

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the enable/disable status of Verbose function
commands.description: This command sets or queries the enable/disable status of Verbose function.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Enable or disable (True/1 = enabled, False/0 = disabled)

validValues.notes: True or 1 = enabled, False or 0 = disabled

queryResponse.description: Returns the enable or disable status of Verbose function

codeExamples.resultDescription: Enable or disable the Verbose function
Returns the enable or disable status of Verbose function

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the enable/disable status of Continuous Run function
commands.description: This command sets or queries the enable/disable status of Continuous Run function.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Enable or disable (True/1 = enabled, False/0 = disabled)

validValues.notes: True or 1 = enabled, False or 0 = disabled

queryResponse.description: Returns the enable or disable status of Continuous run function

codeExamples.resultDescription: Enable or disable the Continuous run function
Returns the enable or disable status of Continuous run function

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the continuous run duration time value
commands.description: This command sets or queries the continuous run duration time value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Duration value: Infinite or hh:mm format (minimum 00:30)

validValues.notes: Infinite sets the radio on button to infinite. hh:mm sets the continuous run duration to the specified time in hours and minutes. The minimum time duration you can set is 00:30.

queryResponse.description: Returns the continuous run duration time value

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the continuous run duration time value
Returns the continuous run duration time value

commands.shortDescription: Set or query the session create option in the continuous run function
commands.description: This command sets or queries the option for session creation in the continuous run function.

validValues.notes: NewSession - creates new session for each run. SameSession_ClearResults - Clears the test results of the current session and starts the test execution.

queryResponse.description: Returns the option for session creation in the continuous run function

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the option for session creation in the continuous run function
Returns the option for session creation in the continuous run function

commands.shortDescription: Returns the report as XML string
commands.description: This command returns the report as XML string.

queryResponse.description: Returns the report XML string

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the report XML string

commands.shortDescription: Copies all the images from current run session to the given destination location
commands.description: This command copies all the images from current run session to the given destination location.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Copies all the images from current run session to the mentioned location

commands.shortDescription: Selects the specified test(s) and deselect all other tests
commands.description: This command selects the specified test(s) and deselect all other tests. Multiple test IDs can be provided as comma-separated values.

arguments.name: testid
arguments.description: Test ID(s) - single ID or comma-separated IDs (e.g., "11101" or "11101,11102")

codeExamples.resultDescription: Selects the test associated with the ID and deselects all other tests in the application
Selects the tests associated with the IDs and other tests will be deselected

commands.shortDescription: Returns the complete information about the selected test
commands.description: This command returns the complete information about the selected test. The information includes application name, TestID, Device selected, Suite selected, version, Test name, Test description.

queryResponse.description: Returns complete test information including TestID, Device, Suite, Version, Name, and Description
queryResponse.example: <TekExpress> <Test Id="11101" Device="TX-Device" Suite="Group1" Version="Spec 1.0" Name="Algorithm Library Measurement" Description="..."/>

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the following details: <TekExpress> <Test Id="11101" Device="TX-Device" Suite="Group1" Version="Spec 1.0" Name="Algorithm Library Measurement" Description="This is Algorithm Library measurement test. Refer Section-B of TekExpress SampleApp Development Guide for more details."/>

commands.shortDescription: Set the default session
commands.description: Sets the application configurations to default value.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Sets the application configurations to default value

commands.shortDescription: Save the run/config sessions
commands.description: Enter the name to save/config the session.

validValues.notes: True or 1 = enabled/override, False or 0 = disabled

queryResponse.description: Returns override status

codeExamples.resultDescription: Saves the session
Overrides the selected config/run session

commands.shortDescription: Load the run/config session
commands.description: Load the selected config/run session.

codeExamples.resultDescription: Loads the selected config/run session

commands.shortDescription: Delete the run/config session
commands.description: Deletes the selected config/run session.

arguments.name: sessionname
arguments.description: Session name(s) - single session or comma-separated sessions

codeExamples.resultDescription: Deletes the selected config/run session

commands.scpi: TEKEXP:SESSION RUN, "Session Name's separated by comma"
commands.shortDescription: Run the run/config saved session
commands.description: Run the selected config/run session.

arguments.name: sessionname
arguments.description: Session name(s) separated by comma (to run multiple run sessions)

syntax.set: TEKEXP:SESSION RUN, "Session Name's separated by comma"

scpi.code: TEKEXP:SESSION RUN, "Session Name's separated by comma"

codeExamples.resultDescription: Runs the selected config/run session

commands.shortDescription: Query the available list in the run/config session
commands.description: Returns the list of available config/run session.

queryResponse.description: Returns the list of available config/run session

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the list of available config/run session

commands.shortDescription: Query the current run/config session
commands.description: Returns the selected config/run session.

queryResponse.description: Returns the selected config/run session

codeExamples.resultDescription: Returns the selected config/run session
